message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire this valuable item. I'm willing to offer it to you for $12,000. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value of the product.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand your perspective, but I'm not willing to go as low as $9,000. I'm willing to compromise and offer the product to you for $11,000. This is a fair price considering the product's value to me. What do you think?

Thank you for the revised offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $10,200. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value to me.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Bob. However, I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make another compromise and offer the product to you for $11,500. This is the highest price I'm willing to consider, and I believe it's still a fair deal considering the product's value to me. What do you think?

Thank you for the revised offer, Alice. I understand that you're trying to reach a compromise, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make a final offer of $10,500. I think this is the maximum I can afford, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're making a final offer, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer the product to you for $12,000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to consider, and I believe it's still a fair deal considering the product's value to me. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to make one more compromise, but I'm afraid I'm still not comfortable with the price. I've reached my maximum budget of $8,000, and I'm not willing to go above that. I'm willing to walk away if we can't come to an agreement. I'm willing to make one final offer of $8,000. This is my absolute maximum, and I hope you can understand my position.

I understand your position, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $8,000. I'm willing to make one more offer, but it will be my final one. I'll offer the product to you for $13,000. This is the absolute minimum price I'm willing to consider, and I hope you can understand my position. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
